mixed-citation.article-title: Kryptochroma: a new genus of bark-dwelling crab spiders (Araneae, Thomisidae)

tp:treatment-sec.p:
Mello-Leitão (1929) also designated a “cotype” (MNHN 17335) of
S. renipalpis
from Pernambuco ; however, the specimen was not found.

The male of
K. renipalpis
is similar to that of
K. quinquetuberculata
due to their well-developed MS, light clypeus and white macula on dorsum ( Fig. 15A–B ). However, it can be distinguished from this and other congeneric species by the medially positioned spermatic duct ( Figs 15C, E , 19D) and extreme curvature of the RTA, which is thinner than in the other species and smooth at the tip ( Figs 15D, F , 19D).
